verses.verse: "Bezalel <WH1212> and Oholiab <WH171> shall work <WH6213> with every <WH2450> wise-hearted <WH3820> man, <WH376> in whom <WH1992> Yahweh <WH3068> has put <WH5414> wisdom <WH2451> and understanding <WH8394> to know <WH3045> how to work <WH6213> all the work <WH6213> for the service <WH5656> of the sanctuary, <WH6944> according to all that Yahweh <WH3068> has commanded. <WH6680>"

Moses <WH4872> called <WH7121> Bezalel <WH1212> and Oholiab, <WH171> and every <WH2450> wise-hearted <WH3820> man, <WH376> in whose heart <WH3820> Yahweh <WH3068> had put <WH5414> wisdom, <WH2451> even everyone whose heart <WH3820> stirred him up <WH5375> to come <WH7126> to the work <WH4399> to do it: <WH6213>

and they received <WH3947> from <WH6440> Moses <WH4872> all the offering <WH8641> which the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> had brought <WH935> for the work <WH4399> of the service <WH5656> of the sanctuary, <WH6944> with which to make <WH6213> it. <WH935> They brought yet to him freewill offerings <WH5071> every morning. <WH1242>
All the wise men, <WH2450> who performed <WH6213> all the work <WH4399> of the sanctuary, <WH6944> each <WH376> came <WH935> from his work <WH4399> which they did. <WH6213>

They spoke <WH559> to Moses, <WH4872> saying, <WH559> "The people <WH5971> bring <WH935> much more <WH7235> than enough <WH1767> for the service <WH5656> of the work <WH4399> which Yahweh <WH3068> commanded <WH6680> to make. <WH6213>"

Moses <WH4872> gave commandment, <WH6680> and they caused it to be proclaimed <WH6963> throughout the camp, <WH4264> saying, <WH559> "Let neither man <WH376> nor woman <WH802> make <WH6213> anything <WH4399> else for the offering <WH8641> for the sanctuary. <WH6944>" So the people <WH5971> were restrained <WH3607> from bringing. <WH935>
For the stuff <WH4399> they had was sufficient <WH1767> for all the work <WH4399> to make <WH6213> it, <WH3498> and too much.

All the wise-hearted <WH2450> men <WH3820> among those who did <WH6213> the work <WH4399> made <WH6213> the tabernacle <WH4908> with ten <WH6235> curtains; <WH3407> of fine twined <WH7806> linen, <WH8336> blue, <WH8504> purple, <WH713> and scarlet, <WH8144> with cherubim, <WH3742> the work <WH4639> of the skillful <WH2803> workman, <WH6213> they made them.

The length <WH753> of each <WH259> curtain <WH3407> was twenty <WH6242> eight <WH8083> cubits, <WH520> and the breadth <WH7341> of each <WH259> curtain <WH3407> four <WH702> cubits. <WH520> All the curtains <WH3407> had one <WH259> measure. <WH4060>
He coupled <WH2266> five <WH2568> curtains <WH3407> to one <WH259> another, <WH259> and the other five <WH2568> curtains <WH3407> he coupled <WH2266> one <WH259> to another. <WH259>

He made <WH6213> loops <WH3924> of blue <WH8504> on the edge <WH8193> of the one <WH259> curtain <WH3407> from the edge <WH7098> in the coupling. <WH4225> Likewise he made <WH6213> in the edge <WH8193> of the curtain <WH3407> that was outmost <WH7020> in the second <WH8145> coupling. <WH4225>

He made <WH6213> fifty <WH2572> loops <WH3924> in the one <WH259> curtain, <WH3407> and he made <WH6213> fifty <WH2572> loops <WH3924> in the edge <WH7097> of the curtain <WH3407> that was in the second <WH8145> coupling. <WH4225> The loops <WH3924> were opposite <WH6901> one <WH259> to another. <WH259>

He made <WH6213> fifty <WH2572> clasps <WH7165> of gold, <WH2091> and coupled <WH2266> the curtains <WH3407> one <WH259> to another <WH259> with the clasps: <WH7165> so the tabernacle <WH4908> was a unit. <WH259>
He made <WH6213> curtains <WH3407> of goats <WH5795>' hair for a covering <WH168> over the tabernacle. <WH4908> He made <WH6213> them eleven <WH6249> curtains. <WH3407>

The length <WH753> of each <WH259> curtain <WH3407> was thirty <WH7970> cubits, <WH520> and four <WH702> cubits <WH520> the breadth <WH7341> of each <WH259> curtain. <WH3407> The eleven <WH6249> curtains <WH3407> had one <WH259> measure. <WH4060>
He coupled <WH2266> five <WH2568> curtains <WH3407> by themselves, <WH8337> and six curtains by themselves. <WH3407>

He made <WH6213> fifty <WH2572> loops <WH3924> on the edge <WH8193> of the curtain <WH3407> that was outmost <WH7020> in the coupling, <WH4225> and he made <WH6213> fifty <WH2572> loops <WH3924> on the edge <WH8193> of the curtain <WH3407> which was outmost in the second <WH8145> coupling. <WH2279>
He made <WH6213> fifty <WH2572> clasps <WH7165> of brass <WH5178> to couple <WH2266> the tent <WH168> together, <WH2266> that it might be a unit. <WH259>
He made <WH6213> a covering <WH4372> for the tent <WH168> of rams <WH352>' skins <WH5785> dyed red, <WH119> and a covering <WH4372> of sea cow <WH8476> hides <WH5785> above. <WH4605>
He made <WH6213> the boards <WH7175> for the tabernacle <WH4908> of acacia <WH7848> wood, <WH6086> standing up. <WH5975>
Ten <WH6235> cubits <WH520> was the length <WH753> of a board, <WH7175> and a cubit <WH520> and a half <WH2677> the breadth <WH7341> of each <WH259> board. <WH7175>
Each <WH259> board <WH7175> had two <WH8147> tenons, <WH3027> joined <WH7947> one <WH259> to <WH413> another. <WH259> He made <WH6213> all the boards <WH7175> of the tabernacle this way. <WH4908>
He made <WH6213> the boards <WH7175> for the tabernacle: <WH4908> twenty <WH6242> boards <WH7175> for the south <WH5045> side <WH6285> southward. <WH8486>

He made <WH6213> forty <WH705> sockets <WH134> of silver <WH3701> under the twenty <WH6242> boards; <WH7175> two <WH8147> sockets <WH134> under one <WH259> board <WH7175> for its two <WH8147> tenons, <WH3027> and two <WH8147> sockets <WH134> under another <WH259> board <WH7175> for its two <WH8147> tenons. <WH3027>
For the second <WH8145> side <WH6763> of the tabernacle, <WH4908> on the north <WH6828> side, <WH6285> he made <WH6213> twenty <WH6242> boards, <WH7175>
and their forty <WH705> sockets <WH134> of silver; <WH3701> two <WH8147> sockets <WH134> under one <WH259> board, <WH7175> and two <WH8147> sockets <WH134> under another <WH259> board. <WH7175>
For the far part <WH3411> of the tabernacle <WH4908> westward <WH3220> he made <WH6213> six <WH8337> boards. <WH7175>
He made <WH6213> two <WH8147> boards <WH7175> for the corners <WH4742> of the tabernacle <WH4908> in the far part. <WH3411>

They were double <WH8382> beneath, <WH4295> and in the same <WH8382> way <WH3162> they were all the way to its top <WH7218> to one <WH259> ring. <WH2885> He did <WH6213> this to both <WH8147> of them in the two <WH8147> corners. <WH4740>
There were eight <WH8083> boards, <WH7175> and their sockets <WH134> of silver, <WH3701> sixteen <WH8337> sockets; <WH134> under every <WH259> board <WH7175> two <WH8147> sockets. <WH134>
He made <WH6213> bars <WH1280> of acacia <WH7848> wood; <WH6086> five <WH2568> for the boards <WH7175> of the one <WH259> side <WH6763> of the tabernacle, <WH4908>

and five <WH2568> bars <WH1280> for the boards <WH7175> of the other <WH8145> side <WH6763> of the tabernacle, <WH4908> and five <WH2568> bars <WH1280> for the boards <WH7175> of the tabernacle <WH4908> for the hinder part <WH3411> westward. <WH3220>
He made <WH6213> the middle <WH8484> bar <WH1280> to pass <WH1272> through <WH8432> in the midst of the boards <WH7175> from the one end <WH7097> to the other. <WH7097>

He overlaid <WH6823> the boards <WH7175> with gold, <WH2091> and made <WH6213> their rings <WH2885> of gold <WH2091> for places <WH1004> for the bars, <WH1280> and overlaid <WH6823> the bars <WH1280> with gold. <WH2091>

He made <WH6213> the veil <WH6532> of blue, <WH8504> purple, <WH713> scarlet, <WH8144> and fine twined <WH7806> linen: <WH8336> with cherubim. <WH3742> He made <WH6213> it the work <WH4639> of a skillful workman. <WH2803>

He made <WH6213> four <WH702> pillars <WH5982> of acacia <WH7848> for it, <WH6823> and overlaid them with gold. <WH2091> Their hooks <WH2053> were of gold. <WH2091> He cast <WH3332> four <WH702> sockets <WH134> of silver for them. <WH3701>

He made <WH6213> a screen <WH4539> for the door <WH6607> of the tent, <WH168> of blue, <WH8504> purple, <WH713> scarlet, <WH8144> and fine twined <WH7806> linen, <WH8336> the work of an embroiderer; <WH7551>

and the five <WH2568> pillars <WH5982> of it with their hooks. <WH2053> He overlaid <WH6823> their capitals <WH7218> and their fillets <WH2838> with gold, <WH2091> and their five <WH2568> sockets <WH134> were of brass. <WH5178>
